gurmukhi: ਡਿੱਗੇ ਰਣ ਸੁੰਡੀ ਸੁੰਡਾਣੰ ॥ ਧਰ ਭੂਰੰ ਪੂਰੰ ਮੁੰਡਾਣੰ ॥੧੨੭॥
transliteration: Digge Ran Soundisoundaanan|| Dhar Bhooran Pooran Muaadaanan||127||
translation: The trunks of the elephants began to fell in the battlefield and the whole earth was filled with hacked heads.127.
Parashuram, who had abandoned his desires created a sensation in all the four directions,
And began to discharge arrows like the brave fighers.128.

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਬਰ ਗਯਾਨੰ ॥ ਪਰ ਹਰਿ ਧਯਾਨੰ ॥
transliteration: Dar Bar Gyaanan|| Par Har(i) Dhyaanan||
translation: Observing his fury, the men of wisdom, meditated on the Lord,
And began to repeat the name of Lord, trembling with fear.129.
Agonised by extreme rage, the intellect was destroyed.
A stream of arrows flowed from his hands and with them the life-breath of opponents was removed.130.
Holding their arrows in their hand s and filled with pride,

gurmukhi: ਅਰ ੳੁਰ ਸਾਲੀ ॥ ਧਰ ੳੁਰ ਮਾਲੀ ॥੧੩੧॥
transliteration: Ar Ur Saalee|| Dhar Ur Maalee||131||
translation: The warriors are imposing them in the hearts of the enemies like the hoeing of the earth by the gardener.131.
All tremble on account of the fury by the warriors and because of their activities in respect of warfare.

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਬਰ ਕਰਣੰ ॥ ਘਰ ਬਰ ਹਰਣੰ ॥੧੩੨॥
transliteration: Gad Bar Karanan|| Ghar Bar Haranan||132||
translation: The masters of the horses were being destroyed.132.

gurmukhi: ਛਰ ਹਰ ਅੰਗੰ ॥ ਚਰ ਖਰ ਸੰਗੰ ॥
transliteration: Chhar Har Anadg|| Char Khar Sanadg||
translation: Every limb of the warriors was pierced by arrows,

gurmukhi: ਜਰ ਬਰ ਜਾਮੰ ॥ ਝਰ ਹਰ ਰਾਮੰ ॥੧੩੩॥
transliteration: Jar Bar Jaamannd|| Jhar Har Raamannd||133||
translation: And Parashuram began to shower a volley of his arms.133.
